name: PaintShop Pro Image
summary: Learn about .PSPIMAGE files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: Corel introduced the PSPIMAGE image format when it released version 8 of Paint Shop Pro (PSP), the predecessor to PaintShop Photo Pro. The format replaced .PSP files as the native format for saving images.
To create a PSPIMAGE file with PaintShop Pro:
Select File → New or File → New From Templates to create a PSPIMAGE file from a PaintShop Pro template.
Select File → Save or Save As.

description: A PSPIMAGE file is a graphics image saved using Corel PaintShop Pro software that is used for image and digital photo editing. It supports saving image data in both raster and vector file formats. PSPIMAGE files support edits made to an image such as layers, transparency, filters and other image effects. PSPIMAGE files can be saved and exported to other popular image file formats such as JPEG, PNG, and BMP.

A PSPIMAGE file is a graphic saved by Corel PaintShop Pro, a program for editing images and digital photos. It may contain raster and vector graphics and supports layers, transparency, filters, and other image effects. Since PSPIMAGE files are the native files saved by PaintShop Pro, they often store touched-up digital photos and artwork.

instructions: ACD Systems Canvas (Windows)Corel Painter (Windows & Mac)Corel PaintShop Pro (Windows)Corel VideoStudio Pro (Windows)CorelDRAW Graphics Suite (Windows)XnViewMP (Windows, Mac & Linux)

You can open a PSPIMAGE file with Corel PaintShop Pro (Windows) by selecting File → Open.... You can also open PSPIMAGE files with CorelDRAW Graphics Suite (Windows and macOS), Corel Painter (Windows and macOS), ACD Systems Canvas (Windows), and XnViewMP (multiplatform).
Various applications, such as Corel PaintShop Pro and CorelDRAW Graphics Suite, can convert PSPIMAGE files to other formats.
For example, PaintShop Pro can convert a PSPIMAGE file to various image file types, including the following formats:
